text.description: Works because {} is an empty object, i.e. an object value.
Works because false is boolean value.
Works because a boolean field also allows boolean arrays.

Works because "true" is coerced to a boolean value. "true" and "false" are coerced to boolean when parsed into an existing boolean field. When "true" and "false" are used as values on a new field, a text field will be created.
Parsing error because boolean and object are not compatible.
text.failed_reason: failed to parse field [json_boolean] of type [boolean]

text.description: Parsing error because boolean and text are not compatible.

text.description: Works because true is a boolean value.
Works because a text field also allows text arrays.
Parsing error because text and object are not compatible.
text.failed_reason: failed to parse field [json_string] of type [text]

text.description: Works because false is coerced to text.
Works because a number (integer) is a text.
Works because a number (float) is a text.
Works because this is a text field.
Works because this is a text field.
Works because this is a text field.

Field mapping error because "json_object.text.new": ... is the same as "json_object.text": { "new": ... }. This would add the "new" sub-field to "json_object.text" which does not work because "json_object.text" is a text field - but sub-fields can only be added to object fields.
text.failed_reason: Could not dynamically add mapping for field [json_object.text.new]. Existing mapping for [json_object.text] must be of type object but found [text].

text.description: Object mapping error because json_object.object is an object field and object and text are not compatible. "json_object.object": ... is the same as "json_object": { "object": ... }.
text.failed_reason: object mapping for [json_object.object] tried to parse field [json_object.object] as object, but found a concrete value

text.description: Adds a new sub-field named "new" to "json_object.object" because "json_object.object.new": ... is the same as "json_object.object": { "new": ... }. Works because "json_object.object" is an object field.
Works because the "json_null" field does not exist yet. Creates a new object field.
Works because the "json_empty_array" field does not exist yet. Creates a new object field.
